MALCOLM and SARAH race back up onto the ridge trail, wher green AAV is parked.  NICK bursts around from the other s of the car. SARAH
Nick, thank God, we didn't know if -- Malcolm opens the rear door. NICK
Wait, don't --- With a piercing SHRIEK, the BABY TYRANNOSAUR, now in the of the AAV, flings itself at the open doorway, jaws SNAPP just short of Malcolm's nose. MALCOLM
He SLAMS the door.
Roland hears the commotion up on the ridge and looks up. ROLAND
Do we have anyone up there?
Malcolm is confronting Nick. MALCOLM
NICK
It has a broken leg! MALCOLM
So do it a favor and put it out of its misery! NICK
No!  Get in the car before they hear  us! He runs around and leaps in the driver's seat.  Sarah sli into the passenger seat, quickly, leaving Malcolm no choi but the rear.
The AAV SLAPS through the jungle foliage.  From inside th car, we can hear the baby tyrannosaur SCREAMING in anger.
The baby writhes on the base seat next to Malcolm, who ha flattened himself against the door, as far away from the animal as possible. SARAH

Ian, close the window, it's going to wake every predator in the jungle! Malcolm leans over the enraged animal and cranks up its window.  The tyrannosaur SLASHES with one of its powerful legs, ripping the flesh of his forearm.  He SHOUTS in pai Outside, the listening jungle whizzes by.

Up in the high hide, EDDIE, DR. JUTTSON, and KELLY are standing watch, scanning the jungle for any sign of their returning comrades. Juttson yanks the night-vision binoculars away from his f as he spots the AAV, pulling up to the base camp a couple hundred yards away. JUTTSON
There they are! They all turn and look, but Eddie furrows his brow, watch them pull the wounded animal from the back seat. EDDIE
What is that they have with them?
SARAH and NICK carry the SCREECHING baby tyrannosaur in t arms, headed for the trailer.  MALCOLM, holding his bleed arm, isn't far behind.
SARAH and NICK bring the SCREAMING infant to the metal di table and hold it down.  MALCOLM is right behind them. MALCOLM
This is exceedingly unwise. Sarah turns away from a drawer of medical supplies, holdi small syringe.  Her shirt is streaked with blood from the baby's injured leg. SARAH
Too late to worry about that!  Hold him together, Nick! Nick tightens his grip on the animal and Sarah makes an injection into its thigh, over its loudly voiced objectio MALCOLM

Just do whatever you have to do and get it out of here as quickly as possible. Sarah picks up a small ultrasound transducer and runs it the animal's leg.  A green and white skeletal image appea a monitor next to the table. SARAH
Okay, there's the metatarsals -- tibia, fibula -- there it is!  See it?  That's a fracture, just above the epiphysis. They peer closely at the monitor. NICK
That little black line? SARAH

That little black line means death for this infant.  The fibula won't heal straight, so the ankle joint can't pivot when he stands on his hind feet.  The baby won't be able to run, and probably can't even walk. It'll be crippled, and a predator will pick it off before it gets more than a few weeks old. MALCOLM
Can you set up? SARAH (thinking)
It has to be temporary, something that'll break apart and fall off as the animal grows... MALCOLM
Think fast, Sarah. The tyrannosaur, still in pain, SHRIEKS again.
Through their binoculars, the rest of the group watches t trailer carefully.  Even inside, the animal's SCREECHES a clearly audible.  Kelly is getting scared. KELLY
What are they doing?  Why don't they hurry?! EDDIE
Give me the radio. From the trailer, the baby lets out a long, plaintive
One by one, Eddie, Kelly, and Juttson turn around and sta into the night jungle.
NICK holds the animal while SARAH fits an aluminum foil c around its injured leg and paints it with a coating of re MALCOLM, at the window, stares out anxiously.  The animal thrashes again. NICK
Give it more morphine! SARAH

We'll kill it with too much, we'll put it into respiratory arrest!  I'm almost done.  Damn it, I need another adhesive, something pliable I can -- Her eyes fall on Nick.  She holds out her hand, urgently. SARAH (cont'd)
Spit! He spits his bubblegum into the palm of her hand.  The ba rex CRIES OUT again.

From the swaying jungle, there is another answering ROAR. And this one's closer. In the high hide, the rest of the group stares, trembling the distance, a flock of birds SHRIEKS and takes flight a tops of some trees move, a whole section of forest sudden coming alive, as if brushed by wind. But it's not the wind. They hear noises, THUDS in the jungle.  And then another section of forest trembles.  Closer.  Another flock of bi bursts out of the treetops and swarms past the high hide. KELLY
What is it? Dr. Juttson puts an arm around Kelly, instinctively pulli her closer to him.  Eddie WHISPERS urgently into the walkie-talkie. EDDIE
Sarah, come in! JUTTSON
It's moving.  Fast.
There is a radio box mounted on the far wall of the trail The speaker BUZZES urgently with Eddie's VOICE. EDDIE (o.s.)
Sarah, Malcolm, can you hear me?! On the table, Sarah is frantically molding Nick's bubbleg into place on the makeshift splint.  But the baby rex, regaining its strength, is thrashing again. SARAH
Hold it down, Nick! NICK
I'm trying! EDDIE (o.s.) (from the radio)
Is anybody there?! Malcolm moves to answer the radio, but Sarah SHOUTS to hi SARAH

Ian, get the bottle of amoxicillin and fill a syringe!  Quick injection of antibiotics and I can get it out of here! Forsaking the radio, Malcolm moves to the medicine drawer comes up with what she wants.  Working fast, he draws twe cc's of the pink liquid. EDDIE (o.s.) (still from the radio, now desperate)
They ignore him as Sarah grabs the syringe and makes the injection. EDDIE (o.s.)
Eddie has given up on whispering as he clutches the radio desperately. EDDIE

head_text.subj: WE ESTIMATE TWO LARGE ADULTS HEADED

text: Nick, Sarah, and Malcolm spin around at hearing that terr piece of information. MALCOLM
Oh, Christ. He bolts over to the wall speaker and hits the button. MALCOLM (cont'd)

Let me talk to Kelly, is she-- A deafening ROAR sound from just outside the trailer, followed immediately by a CRASHING sound.  They whirl and to the window, just in time to see -- --  the AAV tumbling by, rolling on its side! There is another ROAR, and the baby, on the table, ROARS response.  Outside the window, the head of a full-grown TYRANNOSAURUS REX lowers and peers inside. Malcolm, Sarah, and Nick all freeze in absolute terror. The rex outside GURGLES, making material cooing noises. baby rex, calm for the first time, GURGLES back. But across the trailer, in the opposite window, ANOTHER T HEAD SUDDENLY APPEARS. This one ROARS, deeply, a roar so low and loud it rattles anything in the trailer that isn't tied down. NICK
What do they want?! MALCOLM
What do you think they want?! SARAH
That's impossible, they can't have the sensory equipment to track it all the way here! MALCOLM
Current evidence seems to be to the contrary, wouldn't you say?!  GIVE IT

Nick, hands shaking, grabs the shoulder video camera he u earlier.  He whips out the cassette that's in there, hurl into an open duffel bag with half a dozen others, SLAMS a fresh cassette in, and flicks the "ON" switch. Sarah and Malcolm, meanwhile, hurry to the other end of t trailer, carrying the baby rex.  Outside, the two adult r stay with them, walking in the same direction, watching t through the window.

Seen from outside, the light inside the trailers clearly illuminates Sarah and Malcolm as they carry the bay rex. adult rexes tower over the trailer, twice as tall and nea as long.  They walk slowly alongside it, hunched over, watching their infant.
At the door to the trailer, Sarah un-muzzles the frantic SARAH
Ready? Malcolm reaches for the door handle. NICK

Wait! He dives down on the floor under them, pointing the video camera up at the door, getting the best shot.  Malcolm ta breath, turns the knob, and throws open the door. Outside, the enormous rex heads pause for a moment, stari surprised. Although terrified, Sarah actually starts to sing. SARAH (softly)
Born free, as free as the wind blows. As free as the grass grows -- MALCOLM
Are you insane?! SARAH

I swear to God, it works with lions sometimes!  There we are -- your baby is free -- The baby, excited, wriggles free of them and lands on the ground outside.  Not wasting a second, Malcolm SLAMS the shut. The three of them freeze, not daring to breath.  Outside, can hear the SNUFFLING and COOING of the animals as they inspect their young -- -- and then the soft THUD of their footsteps, growing fai as they move away. From the wall, EDDIE'S VOICE comes over the radio, reliev EDDIE
They're going back into the jungle.
EDDIE, JUTTSON, and KELLY sag back against the railings o high hide. EDDIE
Thank God.  Thank God. MALCOLM'S VOICE comes over the radio. MALCOLM (o.s.)
Kelly?  Are you all right? She takes the radio, her voice shaky. KELLY
Uh huh.
MALCOLM is at the radio. MALCOLM
Wait there.  I'll come up in a minute.  Don't move, understand? KELLY (o.s.)

I understand. Malcolm slump against the wall of the trailer.  SARAH and NICK sit on the floor leaning against the opposite wall, completely drained.  Sarah pulls out her pocket recorder speaks shakily into it. SARAH
Note to Dr. Juttson -- Tyrannosaurus rex does nurture its young. They laugh weakly. NICK

There's, uh -- there's an unwritten rule when a news crew is in a war zone.  You stop the van every two miles and decide whether or not to go on.  Whether or not you feel lucky. One "no" from anybody in the group and you turn around right there, no question asked, nobody embarrassed. (pause)
Well?  Do we go on? Immediately: SARAH
No. MALCOLM
No. NICK
No way. They all laugh. MALCOLM
All right.  I'm satisfied with the evidence we have right now. I feel vindicated.  John Hammond will too. (to Sarah)
Do you have enough to publish? SARAH
They will come after me.  But I can collect some stool samples, for DNA with that, Nick's tapes, and the rest of you to back me up, it should stand when we get back. MALCOLM (getting up)

Then the only thing left to do is make sure we do get back.  I'll call the mainland on the satellite phone and have them send the boat right now.  This expedition is over. He goes to the desk and picks up the heavy gray satellite phone that's resting in a battery pack.  The front panel lights up, a brilliant green. But from the wall speaker, the radio CRACKLES and EDDIE'S VOICE breaks through, soft and empty. EDDIE (o.s.)
Oh, God.  I am so sorry. Malcolm and Sarah look at the speaker box. MALCOLM

What the hell is he sorry f- A low RATTLE sneaks into the trailer.  Malcolm, Sarah, an Nick takes a step forward from the walls, looking around. RATTLE gets louder, the trailer shakes and vibrates, everything in it starts to BANG against the walls -- -- and something huge SMASHES into the side of the traile They're all thrown against the far wall, there is an earsplitting CRACK of electricity, the entire trailer roc and sparks a brilliant blue, and then everything goes bla The satellite phone flies out of Malcolm's hands and SMAC against the wall.  It lands on the floor, its number pad glowing green. Nick crawls over and looks out one of the windows.  Outsi the flank of one of the tyrannosaurs wipes past the windo revealing the second tyrannosaur, charging straight at th trailer! NICK

They hurl themselves at the nearest solid object and hang for dear life.  The charging rex SLAM into the side of th trailer, which rocks up on one side, BANGS back  down, an quickly RAMMED again by the furious animal.  This time th entire trailer rolls over, completely upside down. Sarah, Nick, and Malcolm let go of their precarious handh and drop onto the ceiling.  The tables, chairs, lab equip everything that's bolted down clings to the floor above t everything that isn't RAINS DOWN ON THEM. But the rexes aren't done.  The trailer JOLTS INTO MOTION sliding forwards.
the upside down trailer, which is the rear of the two trailers, slides along the muddy ground, pushing up earth front of it.
SARAH

They're pushing us! Malcolm, frantic, crawls up to a window to get a look out He looks down and sees a T-rex footprint in the earth out as they move past it. He cranks his head to get a look at the direction in whic they are being pushed.  His eyes widen at something he se outside the window. MALCOLM
Oh, God. SARAH
What?! MALCOLM

They're pushing us over the cliff. Sure enough, out the back window, we see a few more feet muddy earth, and then nothing but inky black.  The three them look at each other for a moment -- -- and then crawl like hell toward the other end of the trailer.  The opposite end reaches the edge of the cliff starts up to tip ever-so-slightly downward.  They reach t accordion-like connector and Malcolm crawls into it.

head_text.subj: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD OF THE FRONT TRAILER,

text: which is right-side-up, Malcolm can see the two rexes har it, pushing the front end of the trailer.

Nick has a pretty good grip at the top of the trailer, bu Sarah can only cling to an air vent in the ceiling as stu starts to roll and tumble past her, headed downhill. The angle increases, the trailer dips, and now stuff star freefall, right past her, some SMASHING her in the head. Malcolm, still in the connecting tube, grabs hold.  Sarah starting to be pulled downward, paws at the refrigerator, getting a g rip on the handle.  The door, held by a safet latch, doesn't open. Below Sarah, debris falls to the rear window of the trail Through the CRACKING glass, we can see the surf, CRASHING hundred feet below. The refrigerator bolts suddenly CRUNCH free of the wall. box strains on its power cord. Still clinging to the handle, Sarah swings wildly as it s to come loose, swaying above her. The safety latch on the door gives, it swings open, and a shower of food BANGS off of her as gravity empties the contents. Sarah loses her grip and plummets through the now-vertica trailer.  She SCREAMS, covers her head, and SMASHES into rear window.  The glass spiderwebs, but does not break.
an enormous wave POUNDS the rocky shore.  Above, Sarah is tiny figure, sprawled out on the glass, held invisibly by breaking window.
Nick SHOUTS to her. NICK

Sarah, stunned by the fall, blinks a few times, regaining senses.  She looks down, at the crashing surf so far belo For a person with a fear of heights, this is a real drag. she stares, the rocks seem to move even farther away from She blanches; the world spins around her. SARAH

OH... GOD ... please... Her breath fogs the cracked glass.  Slowly, she tries to up, caaaaaarefully pulling herself up to her hands and kn But as she puts pressures on her hands, the glass CRACKS more, tiny spiderwebs shooting out around her fingers.  T whole glass panel sags, bowing out around the bottom of t trailer.
Malcolm looks down and sees the satellite phone precariou balanced on one leg of the kitchen table, its number pad glowing green.  Nick is closest to it. MALCOLM
Nick!  Grab the phone!
looks to her right, at a metal grating that runs along th wall of the trailer.  She shifts her weight, leaning on o hand to reach for the grating with the other.
reaches for the satellite phone, its antenna just six inc from his outstretched fingers.

leans toward the metal grating, all hairline cracks shoot around her pivot hand, shaking through the glass.  The splintered glass spread like a disease, it reaches the ed of the frame -- -- and her hand CRACKS right through the glass.  She GASP pulls her hand out, but now she knees SMASH through the glass.
has two fingers on the phone, but suddenly the whole trai shudders and the heavy phone tips off the table leg and f NICK
lunges for the metal grating and clings to it just as the heavy phone whizzes past her head and SMASHES into the gl opening up a huge hole in the center of the back window.
glass, food, lab equipment, and the precious satellite ph fall out the broken window and SMASH on the rocks far bel
the trailers are split, like an L, the rear trailer hangi straight down, the forward one resting on the edge of the cliff.  Satisfied with their work, the T-rexes turn and l back into the jungle.
Sarah climbs carefully up the metal grating.  Above her, lowers himself as far as he can, reaching for her.
we realize the hanging trailer halted its descent because corner of it is wedged in the branches of a tree that gro out from the muddy cliff. But now those branches SPLINTER.
Malcolm sees the bellows, the connector between the trail stretch as the lower trailer JERKS and dips lower.
Sarah mountain-climbs through the trailer's kitchen, inadvertently kicking the faucet on as she struggles for purchase.
the tree branch SNAPS and the trailer jerks, stretching d again.  The bellows expands to its full length, stretchin like a Slinky.

Nick knows he has to hurry.  He climbs down, bouncing off built-in furniture, moving ever closer to Sarah. But Sarah slips and loses her grip, dropping a few feet. gabs hold of the sink, the flowing water spraying her fac
EDDIE CARR is in the driver's seat of the jeep, racing th the jungle as fast as he can. EDDIE

Hang on -- hang on -- The foliage SMACKS the windshield, then clears suddenly, revealing the endangered trailers on the cliffside ahead him.  The jeep bounces through the deep footprints left b rex and SKIDS to a halt.
Sarah loses her grip on the sink and falls, SMASHING into frame of the half-broken rear window again.
Eddie bolts out of the car and runs to the front trailer. SHOUTS in through the broken front window. EDDIE
The three look up from their precarious positions. MALCOLM
Eddie turns and run back to the jeep.  He grabs a coil of rope, secures one end around a tree, and hurries back to trailer.
Eddie dashes over the mess in the front trailer and crawl into the extended connector.  He peers over the edge, dow into the second trailer, and tosses the rope. EDDIE
Catch! The rope falls through the center of the trailer, its end dangling all the way out the smashed rear window.  But th trailer SHUDDERS, starting to move again. SARAH
We're sliding! EDDIE
Climbs up if you can!

Eddie runs out of the trailer in time to see the wheels dragging forward through the mud as the weight of the dan trailer pulls the whole thing toward the edge of the clif He runs for the jeep and grabs hold of the power winch on front grill. Behind him, the trailer rolls closer to the edge of the c Eddie races back to the trailer, pulling out a length of behind him.  He runs up to the still-moving trailer, dive its towing hook, the cable goes taut -- -- and he falls short.  Just by six inches, but he's out cable. EDDIE
Damn it!
Nick and Sarah are now together, clinging to the rope nea bottom of the trailer as it shifts around them.  Malcolm further up, also clinging to the rope.
dirt and rocks pile up around the wheels and spill over t edge of the cliff. Eddie, back at the jeep, reels out more winch cable.  He and races back to the trailer just as gravity starts to L

head_text.subj: THE FRONT END OFF THE GROUND

text: Eddie dives again, and this time the cable hook CLICKS securely into the trailer's towing hook.  The trailer lur toward the edge of the cliff and stops. But the jeep is jerked forward by the sudden pressure.

Malcolm clings to the rope in the middle of the trailer w Nick and Sarah try to struggle up it, but a sudden dig kn them back, and their hands slide down the line.  SCREAMIN they slide through the trailer and their feet SMASH throu the remains of the rear window. Regaining hold of the rope at the very end, the two of th now find themselves hanging out of the rear end of the tr dangling over the rocky shore below.
Eddie hits the gas and the tires slosh in the mud, trying get a grip.  The jeep pulls just enough to lower the fron trailer back to earth.  But the tires spin, fighting to h it there.
Sarah and Nick dangle, desperate.

Eddie CHUNKS the shifter into four wheel drive and GUNS t engine.  As the motor ROARS, the sound is topped by anoth ROAR, in the distance. And this one's not a machine.  But Eddie doesn't hear it. GUNS the engine again.  There is another ROAR from the ju Eddie hears this one.  He darts a look at the side view mirror.  In it, he sees one of the TYRANNOSAURS bolt out the jungle behind him. He GASPS and looks at the other side view.  In it, he see OTHER REX racing toward him. The tyrannosaurs STOMP forward to confront the ROARING je The first rex bends over, CHOMPS down on the rear tire, a lifts the car to its teeth. But the spinning tire LINGS in the rex's mouth, burning i Surprised by the fight in this foe, the rex loses its gri the jeep BANGS back down onto the ground. Eddie, horrified, dives down under the steering wheel, to away.  The gas pedal pops up -- -- which makes the trailer pitch over the side of the cli But the rex STOMPS down on the jeep to prevent its escape The trailers stop. Now the rexes lean down, over the jeep, and focus on Eddi who still covers under the steering wheel.  The first rex SNAPS at him, hitting the steering column with it, leavin exposed. He SCREAMS and the second rex lashes in, seizing him in i teeth and tossing him out of the car. Eddie pops up into the air between the two rexes, both th heads flash at him at the same time, and in a split-secon disappears between their teeth. Now completely ignored, the jeep rolls freely forward and trailers drop over the edge of the cliff.

Nick, Sarah and Malcolm cling to each other and the rope the trailers fall around them.  The windows flash by as t trailers plummet, equipment BANGS and SCRAPES them, but t hold on to the rope, still tied to the tree, for dear lif

the trailers slide the rest of the way, exposing the thre who pop out the space where the front windshield was. Dangling from the rope, they look up and see the jeep, wh is now rolling to the edge of the cliff. It falls, past them, and the whole mess EXPLODES on the r below.  Finally, it is silent, except for the sound of th surf.

It's quiet up here too, the rexes nowhere to be seen.  At cliff, a hand appears from over the edge.  Then another. SARAH pulls herself up, back onto solid ground, then come NICK, then both of them reach over and help MALCOLM up ov the edge. They collapse there, in the mud, completely exhausted. MALCOLM (softly)
Eddie? He looks at the other two.  They glance around, then drop their heads.  Sarah hears a SOUND in the distance. SARAH

Oh, God.  Now what? From the edge of the jungle, a cris-cross of flashlight b moves toward them.  But rather than the three or four tha would signify their own group, there are nearly twenty of them. The HUNTERS, PETER LUDLOW is in the lead, ROLAND and AJAY with him.  DIETER is there too, shepherding KELLY and DR. JUTTSON along in front of him. Malcolm sees Kelly, they call out to each other, and race together.  Malcolm falls to his knees and hugs her as tig as he possibly can. MALCOLM
Are you all right?!  Anything broken? KELLY
I'm fine, I'm fine, I was scared, I thought you, are you okay?! MALCOLM
I'm fine... I'm fine... Roland looks around, at the mess that was their base camp ROLAND (mostly to himself)
That's what you think.

In the ruins of the first team's base camp, the survivors the night's two separate catastrophes stand face to face, heated argument. MALCOLM sits off to the side, still holding Kelly in his just looking down at the ground and shaking his head.  Th something about his posture of defeat that is far more om than any of the hot tempers that are flaring.  LUDLOW ran SARAH while DIETER looms menacingly over NICK. LUDLOW
Trespassing, sabotage -- you could go to jail just for being here, did you know that? SARAH
Don't start a legal argument with me, this island isn't your property, and neither are these animals! DR. JUTTSON has encountered DR. BURKE. JUTTSON
What are you doing here, Burke? There's no TV cameras, what's the point? BURKE
Dr. Juttson, you exist outside the classroom.  I am amazed. Dieter continues to get in Nick's face. NICK
Are you looking for a problem? JUTTSON (an urgent whisper)
Everyone, keep your voices down! ROLAND
Back off, Dieter. JUTTSON
Listen to me, by moving the baby rex into our camp, we changed the adults' perceived territory! LUDLOW
Their what? SARAH (she understands)
Oh, God. JUTTSON
That's why they persisted in destroying the trailers, they now feel they have to defend this entire area!  We're not safe here. LUDLOW (of Sarah and Nick)
Thanks to you people. SARAH
Hey, we came here to observe, you came here to strip-mine the place! It's a looter mentality, all you care about is what you can take. ROLAND

None of that matters.  Our communications equipment's been destroyed.  If your radio and satellite phone were in those trailers that went off the cliff, and I'm guessing by the look on his face -- He points at Malcolm, who is still off to the side, sitti stunned silence.  Malcolm looks up and nods, slowly.  The grimness of their situation sinks in. ROLAND (cont'd)
We are stuck here, ladies and gentlemen.  And we're stuck together.

Back in the hunters' now-demolished camp, members of the groups combine their diminished supplies.  They have half dozen large plastic containers of water, thirty-seven containers of food, ranging from Ziploc bags to aluminum a variety of weapons, mot of them borne on the hips or shoulders of the HUNTER team, the charred and scraggly remnants of several pieces of now-useless electrical equipment, a flare gun and several flares, somebody's tat paperback ("Crime and Punishment"), a box of Hershey bars a cartoon of Marlboros. ROLAND supervises the assembling of the resources, which displayed in front of him.  LUDLOW, NICK, SARAH, JUTTSON, MALCOLM, who is still holding KELLY close to him, are wit him.  They hold their discussion in quiet tones. ROLAND
If we can't stay in the rex's territory, we have to move tonight. SARAH

Move where?  Our boat's not coming for two days, your airlift is waiting for an order you have no way to send -- Ludlow refers to the charred and trampled satellite photographs of the island, which are still mostly legible LUDLOW

There's a communication center, here, in the old worker village.  Hammond put in some kind of renewable power source replenishing.  It may still work.  If we could get there, we could send a radio call for the airlift. NICK
How far is the village? LUDLOW
I said if we could get there. NICK
Well, how far is it? LUDLOW
A day's walk, maybe more.  That's not the problem. ROLAND
What is? LUDLOW
The velociraptors. Malcolm looks up sharply. LUDLOW (cont'd)

Our infrareds show their nesting sites are concentrated in the island interior.  That's why we planned on keeping to the outer rim. Malcolm shepherds Kelly away from the conversation and mu something to her quietly in the background. DIETER
What are velociraptors? JUTTSON
Carnivores.  Pack hunters.  About six feet long, three or four hundred pounds, and very, very fast. Dieter brandishes his weapon. DIETER
I think we can handle ourselves against them. Malcolm rejoins the conversation, alone.  He keeps his vo low. MALCOLM
No.  I'm quite certain you can't. ROLAND

Look, we have two choices.  We can hike back down to the lagoon, where we can sit for two days, in the open, next to a heavily used water source while we're waiting for your boat to arrive, or we can head for the village, where we might find some shelter and we can call for help. MALCOLM
We'd never make it past the raptors. Trust me, I have some experience in this matter. Roland looks at him. ROLAND
That may be.  But you weren't with me at the time. Malcolm just shakes his head, then turns and walks back t Kelly.  Roland turns to the others. ROLAND (cont'd)
Load up.  Let's get this moveable feast underway.

The SURVIVORS set forth, marching through the jungle in a column.  Two HUNTERS strap on small shoulder-mounted servo-flashlights.  Wires run from the lights end in sensor pads which they stick to the skin of their necks. attached, when the hunters turn their heads, the servo-li turn with them, illuminating whatever direction they look MALCOLM screws the barrel into the Lindstradt rifle and s it over his shoulder as he marches, limping heavily.  He down at KELLY, who is marching alongside him.  His face s the deepest of regret.  He shakes his head, cursing himse MALCOLM
Damn it. He looks away as Kelly looks up at him, questioning.  ROL falls into step with Malcolm and notices his limp. ROLAND
You all right? Malcolm looks at him, then looks away without answering. ROLAND (cont'd)
Wrong question? MALCOLM
You ever heard of Gambler's Ruin? ROLAND
What's that? MALCOLM

A statistical phenomenon.  Says everything in the world goes in streaks.  It's real, you see it everywhere -- in weather, in river flooding, in baseball, in blackjack, in stock markets.  Once things go bad, they tend to stay bad.  Bad things cluster.  They go to hell together. ROLAND
Feeling a bit blue, are we? Malcolm glances at Kelly, who has taken a slightly faster and is a few steps ahead of them now. MALCOLM
Just -- flawed.  Very deeply flawed. ROLAND
Why did you come here? MALCOLM
So that others would know about this place? ROLAND
Why should they? MALCOLM
Because it exists. ROLAND
It'll still exit if they go on not knowing, won't it? MALCOLM
Yes.  And people will live in the absence of truth. ROLAND
So the truth is more important to you than your life? MALCOLM (lowers is voice)
I don't care about my life.  But if I'd ever thought for a second that she would be in danger -- Roland follows his gaze forward, to Kelly, who's about te yards ahead now. ROLAND
She yours?
Kelly can hear their voices, faint, but clear.  They are as far away as they think they are. MALCOLM (o.s.)
I'm afraid so.  I don't know what the hell I'm doing with kids.  I never should have had her. Kelly's face shows she heard that part.
Malcolm, unaware, continues with Roland. MALCOLM (cont'd)
Why are you here? ROLAND
Somewhere on this island, there exits the greatest predator that ever lived.  And the second greatest predator must take him down. MALCOLM
But why? ROLAND

You remember that guy, about twenty years ago, I forget his name, but he climbed Everest without any oxygen, came down almost dead.  And they asked him, "why did you go up there to die?"  And he said "I didn't.  I went up there to live." MALCOLM (nods)

It's called self-testing.  But in your case, it sounds more like self-destruction.  A uniquely human characteristic.  In fact, human beings destroy things so well that I sometimes think that's our function. Maybe every few sons, some animal comes along that kills off the rest of the world, clears the decks, and lets evolution proceed to his next phase.  Maybe death and destruction are our job, maybe we're supposed to destroy ourselves and every other living thing that- Every person on the trail within earshot has stopped and staring at Malcolm, shaken by his words.  Roland grabs Ma by the shirt collar and pulls him close, GROWLING in his ROLAND

Tell you what.  You can see whatever you want to, to me, but you will not spew any more nihilist rants at anyone else in the group.  I'm fighting panic, and you push the wrong buttons.  Understand? Malcolm just blinks.  This guy's in charge.

As a purple dawn dissolves the night sky, the SURVIVORS stagger on, exhausted.  Some are starting to tire, and th are spaces in the column.  MALCOLM's limp seems to be get worse.  NICK reaches out, to take Malcolm's pack, but Mal swats his hand away. KELLY, still ahead of him, falls into step with SARAH. KELLY
I don't think -- my dad doesn't think we're going to make it. Sarah looks at her. SARAH
Your dad is wrong.  About a lot more than he knows. She puts an arm around her.  Kelly looks up at her, grate The long march continues.
NICK catches up to ROLAND. NICK
I think you should call a break. ROLAND
Another half hour. NICK

Some of them won't make another half hour.  We didn't come this far to start dropping in the middle of the jungle.  If you don't call it, I will. Roland looks at him, steely, then SHOUTS to the group. ROLAND
Immediately, the marchers drop where they stood, absolute drained.

head_text.subj: AT THE REAR OF THE GROUP,

text: DRS. BURKE and JUTTSON are bickering. JUTTSON
I can't believe you're still angry about that. BURKE
You know, it's very easy to criticize the first person who studies something. JUTTSON
No, it's easy to criticize sloppy research and hasty conclusions.
MALCOLM checks Nick's bag of videotapes, making sure they still dry and undamaged.  Sarah comes up, watching him. SARAH
You know, even if we do get those tapes back, people are going to say it's just another hoax.  Ian Malcolm's alien autopsy. MALCOLM
Maybe.  Maybe not. SARAH

Ian, they will misplace our evidence, shoot holes in our testimony, and say some special effects genius created the animals.  The only way people will ever believe that dinosaurs exist is if you dump a T-rex in the middle of times Square. He doesn't look at her.  She sits down beside her. SARAH (cont'd)
There's something more important that you should be thinking about instead.

Dr. Burke, furious, has stalked away from Juttson and sit down on a rock.  H does a double take, noticing something behind the rock.  He leans over and picks it up. It's an oval shape about eight inches long, with a pebble exterior.  A dinosaur egg. Burke's face lights up, fascinated, and he carefully piec the egg in a satchel he wears over one shoulder.

head_text.subj: AT THE REAR OF THE GROUP,

text: DIETER STARK pulls a wad of toilet paper from his pack, d the pack on the ground, and turns to the Hunter nearest h CARTER, his driver, who has his back turned. DIETER

Wait here for me, would ya Carter? He steps off the path, into the jungle.  But as we come a the front of Carter, we see he's wearing a Walkman, the headphone BLARING tinnily in his ears. And he didn't hear a word.

Only a few feet off the path, it's primary forest, the gr so thick that almost all sunlight is obscured.  DIETER cl forward until he finds a suitable spot to relieve himself He clears away a bunch of leaves and debris and raises hi hand to his belt buckle.  He freezes, hearing something w didn't.  He glances around, head darting, alert to any da Nothing there.  Just a few distant ANIMAL CALLS-- -- and s SCURRYING around to his left. Dieter snaps his head in that direction.  At first, he se nothing, but as he moves closer, gun extended in front of he sees a small dinosaur, a COMPSOGRATHUS, the same chicken-sized animal Cathy saw on the beach so long ago. DIETER

It's not polite to -- He pulls the steel rod out of a loop in his belt and touc it to the compy's back.  The blue bolt of electricity CRA and dances over the compy's body and it convulses in pain DIETER (cont'd)

-- sneak up on people. The wounded compsognathus scurries back into the jungle, whimpering.  Dieter clambers through the foliage ten or t paces, pushes aside two large palm fronds, and steps out into -- -- more jungle.  He stops, puzzled, not sure if he went b or forward. He looks behind him.  He pauses, recalculating the path h took coming into the jungle, MUTTERING to himself, gestur with his hands, retracing his steps. He adjusts his angle slightly to the right and heads off that direction.  But after five or six hard-fought steps, stops again.  Still nothing but jungle. DIETER
Dieter's cries are faint, but audible.  The only Marchers enough to hear him is CARTER, but the Walkman is blaring his ears. DIETER (o.s.)
...Carter... me?...

Dieter hears that SCURRYING sound again, this time from h right.  He adjusts his angle again and SCRAPES through th foliage, moving faster and faster. Panicking, he ties to run, but the roots rise high out of ground in the jungle, and he trips on one and falls flat his face. He looks up.  The SCURRYING sound comes again, this time times louder than before, like a hundred feet coming at h Dieter GASPS as something rushes in at him. He whirls to his right.  Whatever it is rushes in from th side as well.  And the left.  And behind him.  Dieter scrambles up into a sitting position -- -- and laughs.  He is surrounded by at least forty compys the same as the one he wounded. For a long moment, they just stare at him.  Slowly, he br his gun around, to point it at them. DIETER

Easy -- wait -- one more sec- As one, the compys SHRIEK and hurl themselves forward, covering Dieter's body.  Their teeth and claws FLASH as t each try to grab a scrap of his flesh, tearing savagely. Dieter SCREAMS and flails, waving his arms and legs wildl Some of the tiny animals lose their grip and sail off, SMASHING into trees or the ground.  But dozens of others on, and Dieter falls over backwards, now lying on his bac the ground. Hysterical, he fights like hell to get to his feet, SCREA shaking, swatting the compys loose.  He spins, and that t seems to work, as the compys themselves begin to panic an drop off of him.  But he also loses his grip on his weapo which goes flying, landing in the thick foliage five or s feet from him. Losing the attack, the compys turn and dart away en masse stopping ten yards away from him. But they turn and regroup, facing him in a line, hopping and down, CHIRPING and SHRIEKING. Dieter bounds into the foliage, looking for his gun.  But compys follow him in and he's forced to flee, abandoning lost weapon. Ten feet on, he stops, knowing he's screwed without the g He turns to face the pursuing compys. They stop. Dieter charges them, SHOUTING, waving his arms. The compys turn and run.  Dieter stops. The compys stop.  They stare back at him.  There is a mom of quiet, then they start to hop again, CHIRPING and SQUEALING. Dieter, tired of this game, turns and runs away. The compys follow.
From the front of the convoy, ROLAND SHOUTS out. ROLAND

Break's over, move on! The exhausted marchers drag themselves back to their feet start to march again.  At the rear of the group, someone Carter, who is still listening to his music.  Carter gets hoists his backpack, and marches away. Behind him, Dieter's pack is left, forgotten, on the jung trail.

DIETER stumbles along, exhausted.  He reaches the edge of stream that runs under the foliage, and his feet slip on stones.  He falls, into the rocky stream. Behind him, the army of compys pours over the little hill just crested.  They disappear for a moment, down an incli -- And then swarm over his body.  In a frenzy of splashin Dieter shrugs them off and crawls away, through the strea He gets to his feet but falls again, this time over a log geyser of water splashes up in the air behind the log as Dieter drops out of sight. The compys leap over the log and disappear from view too, throwing up their own splashes of water.  SCREECHING, CHIRPING, and the sound of TEARING flesh mixes with Diete SCREAMS. Now, as more compys leap over the log and splash into the water below, the geysers that shoot up into our field of are pink. And then they're a deep, deep red.
The group has stopped again.  Near the rear, SARAH, NICK, MALCOLM, LUDLOW, and ROLAND are in a tense conversation w CARTER. ROLAND
How long ago was this? CARTER
Seven, eight minutes. Roland looks at them, thinking.  Finally: ROLAND
Then he's dead.  Nobody tells the little girl.  Last thing we need is screaming hysterics. He turns and heads back to the front of the column. SARAH
We have to send someone to look for him! ROLAND
You go if you like, but we're not waiting for you.  MOVE IT OUT!! They look at each other, appalled, but the column starts move.  Numbed, shocked, but left with no choice, they mov one by one.

The column of MARCHERS has finally reached the island rid where they are silhouetted against the setting sun.  They taking a break, sprawled out on rocks or over the ground. MALCOLM sits next to KELLY, who's sitting on a log. MALCOLM
You okay? She doesn't look at him, just gets up and walks away, goi sit over next to SARAH. Malcolm watches, pained, but Sarah puts an arm around her makes a "she's okay" gesture to Malcolm.

ROLAND steps up to the very edge and peers into the islan interior.  From his vantage point, he's able to see all t way to the far side of the island, a rim of herd black cl miles away.  Between here and the cliffs there is nothing gently undulating jungle. He refers to one of the satellite recon photos. ROLAND
Looks like the worker village is down in there, about a mile and a half northeast from the base of these cliffs. MALCOLM is next to him. MALCOLM
There must be a game trail, some kind of path that goes down there. Roland looks around at the exhausted MARCHERS. ROLAND
They'll have to rest before we look for it.  Eat.  Sleep.  Two hours. Then we hit it.
The group has made camp in the jungle.  The mood is sombe most of the MARCHERS asleep already.  Three or four tents been put up.
KELLY sits quietly in a corner, her eyes wide, knees hugg to his chest.  SARAH comes in. SARAH
There you are.  Your dad's looking for you. KELLY
I doubt that. Sarah takes off her outer shirt and hangs it over a bar t the broad red smear across its front. SARAH
Oh, come on.  Go talk to him. KELLY
Why?  He likes to be alone.  I can stay with you.

all is still.  The nocturnal jungle HOOTS and BUZZES arou the sleeping marchers. In his tent, ROLAND abruptly sits up.  As if he heard something.  He looks out the open flap.  In the middle of campsite, he sees AJAY stop in his tracks, head cocked. Roland gets up and goes outside, joining Ajay in the midd the camp. ROLAND
You hear something? AJAY
No.  I feel something. Roland looks at him.  This isn't so good.  He looks out a shifting jungle.  He notices a thin plume of smoke rising over the trees just barely outside the edge of camp. ROLAND
Oh, no.

Kelly and Sarah have laid down on top of sleeping bags, t to get a few minutes' rest.  Sarah's shirt hangs over the swaying in the gentle breeze coming through the open flap As the shirt dangles there, swinging softly from side to we notice the broad red smear across the front.  Oh, that right -- it's blood. The baby T-rex's blood.

the thin plume of smoke leads down to a tiny cooking fire that's been lit by DR. BURKE. He's set a small frying pan on top of it, and now he CRAC the dinosaur egg he picked up earlier into the pan. Roland and Ajay run up behind him. ROLAND (hisses)

head_text.subj: ARE YOU OUT OF YOUR MIND

text: Burke leaps out of the way as Roland kicks dirt on the fi
Roland, Ajay, and Burke all freeze.  What was that?
Sarah and Kelly sit up.  They felt it too.
ROLAND
Get my weapon. Ajay turns and trots away a few steps, then stops cold, staring down at the ground.
A recent rain has all left puddles scattered around the c impact tremors now create ripples in the puddles -- conce circles spreading to the outer edges.
Sarah and Kelly are frantically sealing up any opened foo into Ziploc bags.

Now they leap into Sarah's sleeping bag, to seal themselv and draw the zipper up, all the way around. Outside, the silhouette of the rex's head passes by the t Sarah works faster, her fingers struggling to close the l few inches, but -- -- the rex head pokes through the flap of the tent.  It sniffs, SNORTING the air in and out.  It looks around the tent. It sniffs Sarah's hanging shirt, the one that is stained the blood of the baby tyrannosaur.  The adult tyrannosaur GURGLES again, COOING and cocking its head curiously. In the sleeping bag, Sarah and Kelly's eyes are barely visible, wide in panic.  The rex sniffs and nudges the ba trying to figure out what this thing is. It rolls the bag over once, decides it's uninteresting, a then rises, straights up -- -- taking the whole tent with it!  The stakes pop out of ground as the tent rises high up into the air and flutter away, leaving the sleeping bag fully exposed on the groun beneath it.

the SECOND TYRANNOSAUR now steps out of the jungle, joini the first.  Panic hits the camp as the sleeping HUNTERS w up.  Many of them start to run. Roland scrambles toward his tent, where he can see his we lying near the open flap.  As he draws close, an enormous T-rex foot stomps down on the tent, driving the rifle dee into the mud. Roland, weaponless, stands frozen, watching as the panick Hunters flee in all directions. ROLAND
But they ignore him, sweeping him up in the wave of flush prey that pours across the campsite.  Some toss random an ill-aimed GUNSHOTS back at the rexes.
NICK bursts out of the crowd, sees Kelly and Sarah strugg to get out of the sleeping bag, and grabs each by an arm. rips them to their feet and sweeps them off ahead of him, the jungle.

head_text.subj: IN THE MIDDLE OF THE CROWD,

text: MALCOLM, blinking back sleep, stands a good head above th rest of the panicking crowd.  Frantically, he scans the g MALCOLM
But he can't see her.
the two rexes join forces, herding the fleeing Hunters in narrow ravine.
Roland scrambles up a steep rock face.  No way in hell he going down  that ravine.  He sees Malcolm, still in the m of the camp, start to head for the ravine. ROLAND
Malcolm runs over and hurls himself at the rock face, scrambling to climb up the smooth, steep boulders. Behind him, one of the rexes spots him and lunges across camp toward him. ROLAND (cont'd)

Malcolm gives it everything he's got, clawing his way up rock face -- -- and rex draws closer and pounces at his legs -- -- and Roland reaches down, grabs Malcolm by the hair and pulls him up, out of the rex's grasp. The rex falls short, but he's close enough that we can he his teeth SNAP together, closing around nothing but air. turns, sees easier prey in the fleeing Hunters, and takes after them. Malcolm lands on top of the rock ledge with a CRUNCH.  Ro unceremoniously dumps a fistful of hair in his lap.
Kelly, in the middle of the fleeing crowd with Sarah and hears her father screaming her name and looks up.  Malcol Roland are on the rock ridge above them, keeping pace. MALCOLM (shouting)

But Kelly continues to flee, as the rexes are in the ravi now, and drawing closer to the group. Some Hunters try to leap up and scale the rocks, but the ravine is deepening, there's no way out.  One rex grabs h of a Hunter in its teeth and hurls him against the rock f The second rex picks up another Hunter and snaps its mass head left and right quickly, to break its victim's neck. Hunter goes flying forward and crashes into -- -- CARTER, Dieter's driver, who stumbles and falls.  The of the fleeing humans run around or over him, but when th rex lifts its foot, we see Carter is actually stuck to th bottom of it -- -- and when the animal takes its next step it CRUSHES him the earth.
Malcolm is frantic. MALCOLM
I gotta get down there!

it's obvious no one is going to outrun the rexes, and Nic knows it.  He bursts ahead of Sarah and Kelly and spots something off to his left. It's a waterfall, apparently right in front of a sheer ro face.  But there's something about the way the water is falling that tells him something. NICK
He grabs each of them and hauls them forward, running str at the waterfall.  Apparently, he intends to jump right i the rock, and he's dragging them along with him. SARAH
NICK
The three of them spring right at the waterfall and disap THROUGH the water. DR. BURKE, fleeing along with everyone else, is watching they vanish.

there is a small recess, which is what Nick had hoped for It's small, only four or five feet deep, but it's just en for him, Sarah, and Kelly to cover behind the flowing wat Breathless, terrified, they can hear the mayhem outside. NICK
Shhhh... shhhh... With an enormous SPLASH, something bursts through the cascading water and crashes into them. Dr. Burke. BURKE

Get out of the way! He pulls his way up against the far wall, as far away fro water as he can. FOOOOM!  Now another shape bursts through the watery curt A Tyrannosaur head.  Burke gave away the hiding spot. The four SCREAM as the rex's jaws SNAP left and right, searching for them, falling just inches short.  They sque as far back against the wall as they can get. The rex can't quite get its head all the way through the opening -- -- so it uses its tongue.  A long, dark blue shape slithe out of its mouth and touches the humans, trying to wrap a them, to pull them out of the cave. Burke, blind with panic, forces himself even further into cave, which pushes Kelly further out. SARAH

head_text.subj: STOP IT YOU'RE PUSHED HER OUT STOP

text: But Burke doesn't listen, throwing elbows to make room fo himself.  His movements dislodge a portion of muddy earth a flurry of enormous cockroaches, eight or nine inches lo each, pour out of the wall and swarm over his face and ne Burke SCREAMS and instinctively leaps away, toward the fl water. And that's all the leverage the rex needs.  It curls its tongue, wrapping Burke up in it and pulling him between i teeth.  SCREAMING hideously, he is dragged out, through t waterfall, and disappears. Sarah, Nick, and Kelly stare in horror as the white scree water turn pink.
Malcolm and Roland see the rex walk away from the waterfa with Burke, leaving the hiding place unmolested.  Malcolm nearly hysterical. ROLAND
She's okay!  They'll stay in there, she's okay!

routed Hunters emerge from the gully at the edge of he jungle.  Ahead of them, there is a large open plain cover long "elephant" grass. AJAY, running along with them, stops abruptly at the edge the grass, SHOUTING to the others. AWAY

Not in the frenzy, they ignore him.  Behind Ajay, the eno shadows of the two pursuing tyrannosaurs stop as well, ho up at the edge of the jungle. Ajay, torn between a sense of responsibility and his bett judgement, opts for the former and races into the grass a the other Hunters, waving his arms.
Roland and Malcolm come out onto a rocky ledge that has a of the plain below.  Roland can see the Hunters leaving t as they plow through the grass. ROLAND
Elephant grass!
the groups of Hunters wades into the middle of the long g One of them stops and turns, looking back at the jungle t HUNTER

They gave up!  They're not chasing us! There are CHEERS, SIGHS OF relief.  In the distance, AJAY VOICE can be heard, faintly calling to them to come back. on the rock in the distance, they can see Roland, waving arms madly. But in the giddiness of their escape, they pay it no mind They continue plowing into the high grass, anything to ge further away from the tyrannosaurs.
the tops of three animal heads rise up slowly, backlit by the full moon.  In the distance, the heads can seethe Hun party.  The heads descend, back into the grass.

they continue forward, oblivious.  Now behind them, four more heads rise up in the grass.  As then descend. On all sides of the Hunters, the grass ripples as animals forward toward them, undetected, inexorable as torpedoes. And these torpedoes are on target.  One Hunter is suddenl dragged down, yanked silently below the surface of the ta grass. In his place, a long, lizard-like tail rises up as the an drops its head to make the kill. Behind him, two more Hunters are taken down, and two more animal tails rise up in their place.  A Hunter ahead hear RUSTLING and turns.  His face turns white as, behind him -- a VELOCIRAPTOR springs out of the grass. Velociraptor runs upright on its powerfully muscled hind the second tow of each foot bearing an extra-large curved claw, carried in a retracted position, with which it slas on attack. Like now.  This raptor SNARLS and SLAMS into the body of Hunter, taking him down.  A feeding frenzy ensues.  The Hunters run in all directions, but are pulled down and va into the twitching long grass. Another raptor enters from the right, leaps high into the past the full moon, SLAMS into the chest of more human pr and takes him down, into the grass. Behind them, Ajay's face falls, defeated.  He looks aroun realizing he too is now stranded in the middle of the lon grass. Around him, four torpedo trails head straight for him. Ajay simply closes his eyes.
Roland turns away from the carnage, pained.

SARAH, MALCOLM, KELLY, NICK, ROLAND, DR. JUTTSON, and PET LUDLOW stand in the ruins of their campsite, their ranks decimated, spirits shattered. Roland is at the hole in the ground where his tent once w He has pulled his .800 Nitro Express from the mud and mor less cleaned it, now he's checking the loads. Kelly, nearly catatonic with fear, clings to Sarah, and i doesn't look as if she'll ever let go.  Malcolm, who is o knees picking through the wreckage of a tent, looks over them, but Sarah waves him off -- "she's okay." Roland appears, standing over the group.  He looks at Mal who has found the Lindstradt rifle, intact. ROLAND
How many rounds did you find for that weapon? MALCOLM
Four, counting the one in the chamber. ROLAND
Don't let it out of your hands again. (to Sara, but looking at Kelly)
Can the kid walk? SARAH
Ask her. ROLAND
Can the kid walk? KELLY
I can.  I can walk. While he addresses the group, Roland straps on one of the servo-lights, the shoulder-mounted flashlights that follo your gaze. ROLAND

We're going to find a path down into the interior of the island.  Load up whatever you think you need, and I mean need.  If you can't carry it indefinitely, don't bring it.  We'll hit the worker village in a couple hours and be out of here before dawn.

Roland bends over one of the three-toed footprints left b rex.  Behind him, the rest of the group is packing up, slinging the remnants of their equipment over their shoul Roland bends over and SNIFFS the footprint.  It's filled a liquid of some kind. He takes his canteen, dumps the remaining water into the ground, and plunges the canteen into the footprint, filli it.  Ludlow hovers over his shoulder. LUDLOW
What is that? ROLAND
Piss. Ludlow doesn't ask.
Roland stares down at the ashes of the cooking fire that to such disaster.  He grabs a handful of the ash and shov in his pants pocket.

ROLAND and LUDLOW (who, along with Sarah and Malcolm, is wearing a servo-light now) maneuver down a rugged hillsid come out in a flattened area.  Ludlow GASPS, looking ahea wonderment.  MALCOLM breaks through the hillside's foliag moment later.  He too stares in amazement. SARAH and KELLY come next, then NICK, then JUTTSON.  One one, they all stop and stare. SARAH

God help us. They're standing in a flat, sandy area lined with boulder the sides.  The flat area stretches fifty yards from side side and as far as they can see ahead.  But that's not wh amazes them so. Everywhere, the sand is dotted with dinosaur skeletons. are huge, apatosaurs, sixty feet from head to tail tip. Others are smaller, herbivores of many different kinds. more intact skeletons lie on their sides, their ribcages of pale bone.  but just as many have been ripped apart, b of carcass tossed in every direction. NICK
I do not feel lucky. ROLAND

Keep moving. They march on, tiny figures moving among the mountainous skeletons by the light of the full moon.  Roland notices carcass in particular, a recent kill.  It's an enormous HADROSAUR with fresh bites taken out of it. He bends down, studying the soft earth around it for footprints.

Malcolm looks up, noticing the bony shapes around them, w fall in heavy shadows like cell bars, seem to be changing He turns, and his servo-light shines on the bones.  But they're not bones any more at all, they're pipes, the ani graveyard now given over to the lifeless skeletons of man objects -- twisted, rotting machinery. LUDLOW
We made it! They hurry over a small rise --

-- and find themselves at the edge of what was once Isla Sorna's worker village.  The size of a football field, th town is divided by a main street that's dotted on both si by stores, residences, cafes, a gas station.  All the way the far end is a large, blocky, four-story building. But the town is a mess.  The hurricane that hit here must been ferocious, for everywhere things are smashed, broken upended.  And the jungle has stepped into the breath, gro up, around, and over everything.  Huge root systems snake through the street, making it almost impassable. MALCOLM
The jungle.  It's always ready to return. Roland catches up and looks at Ludlow. ROLAND
Where's the power and radio setup? LUDLOW

Operations building.  Far end of the street. A light rain falls as they start down the street, careful silently, Roland and Malcolm with their weapons at the re They pass the skeleton of a fallen water tower.  An empty station, its vine-snarled pumps now useless.  The only so is the low mechanical HUM of the servo-lights as they fol the group's gazes obediently. Every few feet, the group encounters strange, grayish lum that lies in random places in the middle of the street. Malcolm, curious, stops and taps one of them.  It's a roc Nick looks over his shoulder. NICK
Lava? MALCOLM
No. NICK
What are they? MALCOLM
I don't know. Finally, they reach the operation building, at the far en the town. LUDLOW
The radio rig is inside.  It runs directly from the geothermal generator, so power shouldn't be a problem. ROLAND

Good. He pulls out his canteen.  Ludlow watches as he screws th off, moves toward the building, and starts splashing the contents on the outside of it. The rest of the group just stares at him. MALCOLM
What's he got in there? LUDLOW
Piss. SARAH
What? LUDLOW
Don't ask me.  The guy's completely out to lunch. NICK
What in God's name would he want with- Roland rejoins them. ROLAND

Tyrannosaur urine.  I don't want anything to do with it, and neither does any other animal on this island. This building is now demarcated as the rex's territory.  As long as you  stay in that building, you'll all be safe until the helicopter comes. He drops his pack, swings his gun off his shoulder, and c the load.  Dr. Juttson looks fearful. JUTTSON
Where are you going? ROLAND
After the rex.  I saw a fresh kill back in the valley with tyrannosaur tracks all around it.  If I'm not back in time, don't wait for me. SARAH
You've got to be kidding. ROLAND
Runs against my nature to hole up in a cave and wait. LUDLOW
Do you think the rex might have the infant with it? ROLAND
Possible. Ludlow takes off his hat and turns to Nick. LUDLOW
You know how to work a radio, don't you? SARAH
You're going too? LUDLOW

I lost everything I came after on this trip, but one T-rex in one theme park could single-handedly bail InGen out of Chapter 11. He takes a slip of paper from the brim of his hat and han to Nick. LUDLOW (cont'd)
This is the broadcast frequency.  ID yourself as "Harvest Leader."  You know what to tell 'em. MALCOLM
You gentlemen feel you have to do this now? ROLAND
Now's the perfect time.  The animal just fed, so it won't stalk us for food.  Predators don't hurt when they're not hungry. Ludlow double checks the clip on his semi-automatic rifle NICK
No. -- and SMACKS it back into the belly of the gun. NICK (cont'd)
Only humans do.
The console of a sophisticated radio set-up glows brightl all green, red, and yellow.  NICK tunes the dial to a spe frequency.  The radio WHINES and HISSES tuning in. NICK (into microphone)

CQ, CQ.  This is InGen Operation Harvest Leader to Harvest Base.  Come in, please. The remaining SURVIVORS, minus Ludlow and Roland, shine t flashlights around the dusty, vine-hung interior of the communications room.  On the wall a row of chrome letters "We Make The Future,"  but the words are obscured by a ta of vines.  Mushrooms and fungi sprout from the carpet. On one wall, there is a mural of what the completed Juras Park would have looked like.  Big hotels, Ford Explorers tourists leaning out the windows taking pictures, big cro at the fences around the animal exhibits.  But none of it true, and now even the mural is runny and dust-covered. There is a pause, filed only with radio static.  Sarah lo at Nick tensely, waiting.  Finally, a VOICE comes over th radio, clean as can be. VOICE (o.s.)
Go ahead, Harvest Leader. They all breath a sign of relief.

With Roland and Ludlow gone on the hunt and the rest of t group inside the operations building, main street stands deserted and silent. Nearly deserted, anyway.  Moonlight shadows lengthen at o end of the street -- -- and FIVE VELOCIRAPTORS STROLL INTO TOWN.

ROLAND AND LUDLOW are back in the valley of death, standi amid the giant skeletons of long-dead animals.  Roland be down, checking the carcass of the freshly-chewed HADROSAU saw earlier. A set of giant three-toed rex tracks leads away from the carcass, down the stream bed.  Roland follows them.  Ludl follows Roland. As they near a bend in the stream, Roland looks down, at surface of the water.  A pattern of ripples moves toward washing over their ankles.  Roland follows the ripples wi his eyes.  From up head, around the bend, he can hear the sound of an animal eating and drinking.  A very large ani He reaches into his pocket and pulls out a  pinch of the from the cooking fire that he scooped up earlier and rele that on the wind.  They float there for a second, suspend then blow back at him. LUDLOW

We're downwind.  Good. Roland darts a contemptuous look at him.  He puts a finge his lips, gesturing for silence, then steps up, onto the shore.  Ludlow follows. They creep forward, toward the sounds.  They round the be and Roland hits his belly, edging up over a small rise. Over the rise, he sees the TYRANNOSAUR, about a hundred y ahead.  It's stooped over the stream bed, drinking.  Like bird, it dips its head in the water and then straightens to let the water fall down its throat.  A dozen COMPYS ar the water as well, drinking. Roland gently FLICKS the safety on his gun to "off." Ludlow edges toward the cover of a low-hanging branch.  A puts his weight on one knee, it presses down hard on the middle of a small stick, which CRACKS in half.  Roland tu eyes blazing. Out in the open, the tyrannosaur snaps its head sharply a well, staring in the direction of the sound.  But since Roland's own head is turned, he doesn't see the dinosaur' reaction.  Roland holds a warning finger out to Ludlow. Roland turns his head back.  The tyrannosaur is gone.

the trail of three-toed tyrannosaur footprints stops abru Roland stops too, gesturing for Ludlow to freeze behind h Roland glances both ways, looking for any sign of the tra To the right, the ground gives way to hard black volcanic A short distance behind them, the rock is solid, a massiv green, pebbled boulder ten feet high.  Roland frowns and WHISPERS in Ludlow's ear again. ROLAND
We took to the rock. LUDLOW

Why? In front of Roland, a palm frond sways gently in the nigh breeze.  Roland's eyes widen.  He pulls out another pinch campfire ash and releases it on the wind. This time, the ash blows off, straight away from him. ROLAND

Wind shift. They freeze, terrified.  Behind them, the enormous green pebbled boulder -- -- opens an eye. That's no boulder, that's the MALE TYRANNOSAUR, standing rock-solid still, its natural camouflage blending into th surrounding foliage perfectly.  Very slowly and almost silently, the rex brings its head all the way around unti is staring directly down at them from about ten feet away Roland and Ludlow stand frozen, their back to the rex, unaware of its presence. Until it exhales.  The soft SNORT of its breath isn't qui audible, but it brushes the hair on the backs of their ne ever so slightly. Their hearts drop into their stomachs.  Ludlow speaks, hi voice a queasy HISS. LUDLOW
It's... behind... us. ROLAND (the very softest whisper)

It's just fed.  It won't attack unless it's threatened.  Don't move. As the rex silently cocks its head, sizing up the danger these intruders, it breathes again.  A few strands of Lud hair flap in the exhalation.  He closes his eyes, near te He can't take it.  His eyes dart, glancing down at the we he holds in his hands.  Unfortunately, it's extended in f of him, away from the rex. He risks another HISS. LUDLOW
If I don't move, I can't shoot it. ROLAND

Let it go, Peter.  The animal won. Behind them, the rex appears satisfied.  It starts to swi its massive head around, back toward the jungle.  It lift great leg and takes a step into the trees. Roland signs and closes his eyes, relieved. But Ludlow seizes the opportunity.  He whips his weapon a and drops to one knee. ROLAND (cont'd)

The rex is infinitely quicker.  Ludlow just has time to squeeze off a short burst of semi-automatic gunfire when animal whirls, takes one elegant step forward, and POUNCE Ludlow's bullets rip harmlessly through the foliage betwe the rex's legs as its big head snaps forward and comes do jaws wide.  They close around Ludlow's body, lift his str up into the air, and toss him once, readjusting their gri it is firmly around his midsection. The whole combination of movements takes but half a secon By the time Roland turns around, the animal has pivoted a darted back into the jungle, carrying Ludlow, still SCREA and writhing in its mouth. Roland raises his gun, to draw a bead on the animal, but through the shivering trees, he can only see that the tyrannosaur is gone.

MALCOLM SARAH, NICK, KELLY, and DR. JUTTSON wait nervousl the communications room.  An empty can of Dr. Pepper sitt on one of the countertops begins to RATTLE.  They look ov it, confused, as the lightweight aluminum can CHATTERS on formica counter. Other objects in the lab begin to rattle too.  Glass jars CLANK against one another, books start to drop off the shelves, a stool shudders across the floor. KELLY

What's going on?! Above them, the rotting wooden roof of the building start actually tear away, chunks of moldy timber flying up into the night.  They look up, a deafening ROAR fills the room -- and a helicopter's searchlight floods in! As the chopper dips lower, looking for a place to land, t violent prop wash rips away huge chunks of the roof over heads.

Up above the operations building, the helicopter circles. roof of the building is all arches and rotten timber, impossible to land open. Below, the PILOTS see the SURVIVORS through the torn roof the building.  They wave frantically, their flashlight be piercing the night sky. PILOT
There they are! The Co-Pilot scans the street below, but it's choked with overturned cars and fallen trees. CO-PILOT
No LZ in the street, too much debris! PILOT

Check the other buildings! The Co-Pilot nods and they peel off, swooping over the re the village. At the far end of the street, the Co-Pilot brings the searchlight to bear on the large, flat roof of a three st building. The Pilot gives him a thumbs-up.

MALCOLM, SARAH, KELLY, NICK and finally DR. JUTTSON run o the front of the operations building.  At the end of the street, they can see the helicopter as it descends slowly the building, to land on its roof. MALCOLM

There it is! Happily, the group double-times it down the street, heade the chopper.  Again, those strange rock formations are everywhere.  Some seem to be on the sides of buildings, a they once dripped there and then turned to stone. This time Sarah pauses at one that is dripping over to th of a car like solidified lava.  Her face falls as a thoug occurs to her. SARAH
Ian.  It's guano. MALCOLM
What? SARAH
These formations.  They're dried -- MALCOLM
Birdshit? A VELOCIRAPTORS jumps onto a fallen tree trunk behind the They don't see it. NICK

Who cares?  Let's go! Unaware of the raptor's presence, they resume their trot toward the helicopter.  Behind them, the raptor crouches SNARLS, but the sound is lost under the WHINE of the helicopter's engines.  It springs, covering the distance between them quickly. The animal SLAMS into JUTTSON, the last person in the gro and takes him down.  Juttson is thrown forward, into the others, who fall like dominoes. Juttson SCREAMS, his voice an unnatural, high-pitched SQU as the raptor flips him over and lowers its jaws into him Sarah looks up, panicked.  Her eyes widen at the sight of SECOND RAPTOR, this one running straight at hr at top spe She buries her face in the dirt, covering her head with h hands -- -- and the raptor's foot SLAMS into the ground between he legs as it bounds over her and dives onto Juttson, joinin first raptor in the kill. Panicked, the group scatters in all directions.  Kelly ju up and scrambles into the middle of the street, where she the dirt and crawls under a fallen shed in the middle of road. Malcolm rolls over to the space where Kelly was, but she' gone now.  He looks around frantically. MALCOLM

Kelly?!  KELLY?! Sarah rolls onto her feet and sprints toward the building nearest her. Behind her, a THIRD RAPTOR gives chase, bounding after he with horrifying speed.  Sarah runs flat-out, but her spee nothing compared to the raptor's, and it gains on her rap The walls of a structure of some kind close in around Sar and as she leaps across a leather seat and SLAMS a door b her, we realize she's crawled into the back seat of an abandoned car. But the car door is thin protection against the charging raptor, which SLAMS into the window, head first.  The win spinderwebs, but does not yield.  The raptor crumples to ground. Sarah looks up, through a three inch hole in the middle o web.  The raptor leaps back to its feet and plunges its n into the tiny hole, thrashing, widening it. Sarah SCREAMS and the animal forces its entire head throu the hole, SNAPPING its jaws just short of her face. She hurls herself over the seat and into the front as the animal penetrates even further into the car, but its tors will not fit through the window opening.  It pulls away. In the front seat, Sarah gets some very bad news. There's no windshield. The raptor springs up onto the hood, its claws CLATTERING the sheet metal, and tosses its body through the opening -- just as Sarah hurls herself out the door.  While the r struggles to right itself in the front seat, Sarah runs t nearest building, ducks inside, and SLAMS the heavy woode door.

MALCOLM races between the idled gas pumps and into the ga station building, closing the door behind him.  A moment later, a raptor bounds after him, SLAMMING into the door. Meeting resistance, it bounces off, notices the plate gla window next to the door, and pounces at that.  The window SHATTERS and the raptor clings to the ledge, staring insi its tail hanging out. Just as it gets inside, Malcolm opens the door and comes out, keeping the place of wall between them.  He pulls th Lindstradt rifle off his back and tries to take aim -- -- but the raptor whirls and springs, forcing him back in through the door again. Willing to play along, the raptor turns and jumps through window again.

Balancing on the window frame, the raptor HISSES and crou ready to spring at Malcolm. Malcolm takes cover behind the door, which is hanging ope between them.  He raises the rifle. Th raptor springs into the door, BLASTING it off its hing knocking Malcolm right through a window behind him. But the door SMACKS up against the wall, covering the win preventing the raptor from following Malcolm out that way For the moment.

Malcolm flies through the window and CRUNCHES to the grou He GROANS  in agony and rolls off his bad leg, which is t unnaturally beneath him, and claws in the mud for the gun ROUGH HANDS reach down, grab him by the shirt, and haul h his feet.  It's NICK.  He drags Malcolm away, but in the commotion Nick's duffel slips off his shoulder and lands the street, spilling some of the precious videotapes. Malcolm scoops them up. NICK
Come on! MALCOLM
Where's Kelly? NICK
She's with Sarah! They race off, down the street.

High above SARAH, we see she is standing alone in a three story kiln house, a windowless shed used for firing potte and other construction projects.  Catwalks lined with hea chains hang above her, and onto the floor below, she turn circles, wondering what to do now. From outside the kiln house, she hears SCRATCHING, diggin sounds.  From the other side of the door comes an animal SNORT, and a small puff of dust and dirt billows up throu the crack along the ground.

head_text.subj: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE DOOR,

text: the claws of one of the raptors dig furiously, trying to tunnel underneath.

Sarah runs to the opposite wall, falls to her knees, and starts digging a tunnel of her own, clawing frantically a ganging tools always and CLANKS as it tears at the earth it. Sarah digs faster.  So does the raptor. With about eight inches of space under the wall, Sarah gr hold of the bottom of one of the plans and pries it up as hard as she can.  It snaps off with a loud CRACK. At the door, the raptor stops digging.  It's silent for a moment. Sarah has a good foot and a half of space under her wall She starts to lower her body into it --

head_text.subj: -- JUST AS THE RAPTOR'S CLAWS FLASH THROUGH FROM THE OTHE

text: Sarah falls back, SCREAMING, leaps to her feet, and jumps grabbing hold of one of the catwalks above.  She starts t climb, up, anywhere up, as the RAPTOR now squirms and thr its way inside, coming in through her hole. Sarah climbs, hauling herself up, leaping from one catwal another. The raptor leaps up onto a catwalk as well and follows he
A window in the slanted roof of the kiln house EXPLODES i shower of glass as SARAH kicks through it and climbs outs

Nick drags a badly limping MALCOLM down the main street. can see helicopter at the far end, engine ROARING and searchlight playing over them as they draw closer.  They approach a rusted, abandoned pickup in the middle of the street -- -- and a RAPTOR leaps on top of it.  Its claws CLACK on t roof as it goes into its pre-attack crouch. They don't stick around to negotiate.  Nick hauls Malcolm into the nearest building.

NICK and MALCOLM hurry inside and SLAM the door behind th They're standing in the lobby of a hotel of some kind, probably used for overnight guests and day workers who ha spend the night.  The room and staircase wind around a la open-aired central area four stories tall.  They SHOUT at other, frantic. MALCOLM
We can't stay in here! NICK
We're sure as hell not going back out there" MALCOLM
This is single-wall construction! It's just a shack! NICK
It'll hold! MALCOLM
For sixty seconds, maybe!  Look at this! (RAPS on the door with his knuckles)

You could- With a CRASH, the wood SPRINTERS around the lock and the swings open violently.  Malcolm is thrown aside, landing on the floor. A VELOCIRAPTOR stands HISSING in the doorway.  Nick throw weight against the door.  SLAMMING it hard against the ra Malcolm rolls over and paws the gun off his back. SLAM!  The raptor charges the door again, this time BLAST it off its hinges, knocking Nick to the floor beneath it. raptor turns and SNARLS at Malcolm. Malcolm swings the gun around -- -- the raptor lunges at him -- -- Malcolm's finger closes on the trigger -- -- and the raptor lands on top of him. The weight of the animal CRUSHES him into the floor, but gun barrel now stands between them.  The raptor CHOMPS do hard on the barrel, its teeth GRINDING on the metal, and its head, to tear it from Malcolm's hands. Malcolm pulls the trigger. The raptor's eyes pop wide as the dart SLAMS into the bac its throat.  It makes a GURGLING sound, then convulses violently and rolls off of Malcolm, yanking the gun from hands as it falls and dies. Nick scrambles out from under the door.  Malcolm tries to wrench the gun from the raptor's clenched jaws, but it wo budge. NICK (helping him out)
Head for the roof! MALCOLM
I have to find Kelly! NICK
I think she's with Sarah! MALCOLM

KELLY remains huddled under the fallen shed, trembling wi fear.  She holds her breath and freezes, as just outside, two feet from where she's hiding -- -- a RAPTOR'S FEET pick their way past her, down the midd the street. Kelly closes her eyes and suppresses a scream.

NICK and MALCOLM burst onto the roof of the now-burning hotel and SLAM the door behind them.  The helicopter is n only three rooftops away.  They turn and head for it, Nic the lead, but there's an eight foot gap between the build MALCOLM
It's too wide! Nick looks around, desperate.  A fallen power pole leans against the building they're standing on, its lines gone slack. NICK

Help me push this! Malcolm understands.  He and Nick throw a shoulder into t pole and give it a mighty push, tipping it over in the ot direction.  One good hard shove and it falls to the far building, THUDDING against it solidly. Its power lines are not taut, a lifeline from this roofto the next.  Nick grabs hold and starts to pull himself acr the gap, hand over hand. Behind them, the door of the building SPLINTERS and CRASH open as a raptor throws all its weight into it.  Malcolm onto the power line without hesitation and starts pulling himself across. But even with the door wide open, the raptor on the other hesitates.  It SNARLS and backs away, refusing to come ou onto the roof.
Malcolm lands next to Nick on the second rooftop.  They l back at the frightened animal, which takes tow steps out the roof, SNARLS, and backs into the doorway again. NICK
It's afraid to come onto the roof! Malcolm looks around, at the rooftop.  Strange bits of sc and debris seem to have been arranged there, in an odd, concentric pattern. MALCOLM
Something's wrong. NICK
Look!  Sarah! He points to the roof of the kilm house, in the distance. Malcolm turns, and sees SARAH crawling across the tile. face turns white. MALCOLM

SARAH has problems.  Still on top of the kilm house, she reaches the edge and pushes off the roof, leaping to the of the next building. She lands at the peak of the intersection of the two side sloping roof.  As she pulls herself up -- -- a RAPTOR appears on the rooftop behind her.  In full stride, it leaps, sails over her, and lands on the roof ahead of her. Sarah swings to her left and starts to crawl down the slo away from the raptor.  Suddenly the roof board under her SPRINTERS and CRACKS under her weight.  The whole section pulls up and starts to slide off the roof.  Sarah, clingi it, rides the roof  planks down, away from the raptor. She looks over her shoulder, down -- -- and sees ANOTHER RAPTOR, waiting for her on the roof o building below. Sarah quickly rolls off the sliding section of roof, whic keeps sliding, falling.  The raptor below jumps up, just time to get WHACKED in the head by the falling roof secti Sarah tries to cling to the Spanish tile roof, fingers an nails slipping on the slick ceramic surface.  She slides the way to the edge, grabs hold of the gutter, and dangle there, suspended above one raptor and trapped below anoth The raptor above works its way down.  The one below leaps at her dangling legs.  She has left them in time with its jumps, to avoid losing her feet.  This can't go on for lo Desperate, she pulls one of the Spanish tiles up from the and hurls it at the raptor below.  It hits the animal in head, for all the good that does. But Sarah keeps on, pulling and throwing more tiles.  She edges to the right, toward a fresh supply. The raptor above edges even closer, claws CLICKING on the slick roof. Something interesting is happening.  As Sarah pulls the l tiles free, the ones above slide down, to take their plac Sarah sees this and pulls more free, knocking them out of way as fast as she can. Suddenly an avalanche of loose tiles breaks loose and the footing underneath the raptor above disintegrates.  The animal's feet flail and grasp, it slides towards the edge the tumbling tiles. Sarah, seeing it coming, swings in close to the building, hugging it as closely as she can.  The raptor falls off t roof, right past her -- -- and CRUNCHES into the raptor below.  Both animals SNAR attack one another. Now Sarah, her grip exhausted, falls too, landing right n to the enraged animals.  They fight and roll, RIGHT OVER She GROANS and hugs the wood below her, the raptors conti to thrash and bite, they roll back, toward her, she rolls of their way -- -- and plunges through a hole in the roof.
