Sarah falls through the roof of a deserted laboratory and lands in the tray of an old-fashioned hanging fluorescent light fixture. One end of the fixture's support SNAPS, it drops at a 45 degree angle, Sarah slides out the other end and CRASHES through a window.
Sarah lands in the mud in the street below.
With a THUD, MALCOLM lands in the mud between two other building, one of which he has just climbed off of.  Panic he leaps to his feet and starts to SHOUT. MALCOLM
Kelly!  KELLY!

SARAH sprints down the main street as fast as she can, to the building on which sits the helicopter.  Above her, sh see NICK has now reached the helicopter and is waving to Sarah reaches the fallen water tower, which is next to th helicopter building, and starts to climb it.

KELLY is still covering underneath the fallen shed.  In t distance, she can see the helicopter.  But she is trembli with fear, unable to move. The whole shed suddenly RATTLES as something heavy hits i outside.  Kelly's mouth drops open to scream, but her ter is so complex that no sound comes out.  She raises her ha in self-defense, whatever's outside ROARS with effort, th entire shed is suddenly RIPPED right up off of her, and s looks up -- -- into her father's eyes. KELLY
Dad! MALCOLM
Come on! He grabs her by the hand and they take off down the stree
Sarah emerges at the top of the water tower structure and leaps onto the roof, into Nick's arms. NICK
Where's Kelly? SARAH

Where's Ian? Eyes wide with panic, they both turn and look down at the street below, where they see KELLY and MALCOLM, racing at speed down the middle of the street -- -- WITH A VELOCIRAPTOR CHASING THEM.

Malcolm and Kelly have a twenty yard advantage on the ani They're pretty fast, but it's faster. Above them, Nick and Sarah are at the edge of the roof, SHOUTING and urging them on.  They push it, faster. They reach the base of the fallen water tower, the jumble struts and metal poles that Sarah climbed. MALCOLM

Kelly leaps ahead of him and grabs hold of one of the pol pulling herself neatly up to her feet and reaching for th next one. Malcolm stretches and makes the same effort, but for him much harder. Below them, the raptor springs and SLAMS into the struts, shaking the whole structure.  It pulls itself up. Higher up, Kelly climbs fast, hands gliding over the pole She breaks out into the open, where a long, narrow pole r on a slight incline up to the roof.  She scampers across running the balance beam. She reaches the other side, on a ledge below the roofline looks back.  Malcolm is at the other end, hesitating, dra breathing hard. KELLY
Below him, the raptor closes in.  Malcolm sets out across beam, his legs shaking.  He places his feet carefully, he doesn't have nearly the balance Kelly did. The raptor draws closer. KELLY (cont'd)

Malcolm slips. One foot twists right off the bar and he spins, arms flai trying to regain his tenuous balance. But he overcompensates and his whole body, wrenches out f under him.  He falls, the bar SMACKS him hard in the ches knocking the wind out of him, and he drops, flipping righ the bar and bouncing painfully through the maze of bars b He drops right past the pursuing velociraptor, CRUNCHING a halt in a nest of bars ten feet off the ground, probabl cracking a rib.  Kelly SCREAMS from above him. KELLY (cont'd)

She stares down in horror at her father.  Wrenched in amo the bars, Malcolm is helpless as the animal crouches only feet above him now, with an open attack route. The animal SNARKS and goes into its pre-attack crouch. Up above, Kelly wipes the palms of her hands on her jeans and leaps out into space, grabbing hold of one of the bar The raptor springs. Kelly spins around, over the top of the bar, and, at the peak of her trajectory, she lets go. The raptor sails through down from above, feet first, SLA both of them squarely into the raptor's side, sending it hurtling into space. She lands hard and awkwardly, CLANGING into the spidery scaffolding next to Malcolm as the raptor SMASHES to the ground below.  But Kelly manages to hold on. KELLY
She grabs hold of Malcolm and pulls him to his feet.
Kelly and Malcolm appear over the roofline.  The PILOTS S from inside. PILOT

head_text.subj: LET'S GO LET'S GO LET'S GO

text: Malcolm and Kelly scramble toward the helicopter.  But at opposite side of the roof, a RAPTOR claws its way over th edge as well. Malcolm sees it and they lunge for the helicopter, but th animal is far faster.  It's only ten feet away, then five they're surely done for this time, when --

There comes the loudest single gunshot anyone has ever he and the raptor flies off its feet and lands ten feet acro the roof, dead.  They look up, to the source of the gunshot. It's ROLAND, standing at the edge of the roof, holding hi smoking .600 Nitro Express. But there's no time for celebration, as suddenly the helicopter's left skid CRACKS right through the surface o roof. PILOT
The skid dips even further, ripping right through the thatch-and-wood construction.  Kelly, who had one foot in helicopter, loses her balance -- -- as the roof caves in beneath her. MALCOLM
She falls,  SCREAMING, through the hole and down, into th building below.

Kelly lands with a CRUNCH on the floor immediately below roof, about nine feet down.  But her landing is cushioned an inordinate amount of straw and leaves that have been arranged there.  She lifts one hand, and a yellowy, visco substance drips off of it. It's yolk.  She looks around, noticing half a dozen large oblong shapes.  Eggs. Above her, Malcolm is scrambling, climbing down to her th the wreckage of the CREAKING, crumbling roof. MALCOLM

Kelly!  I'm coming! Kelly climbs to her knees, but behind her, a large, dark is moving.  Rising.  Unfolding, in a way. IT'S A PTERANODON. Yep, flying dinosaur.  The enormous animal raises its hea brilliant blue crest extending two feet behind its long, saber-like beak.  It SQUAWKS at Kelly in fury.  She can o stare, spellbound. Malcolm reaches her and grabs hold as the angry animal un its massive twenty-two foot wingspread.

the helicopter lurches as it sinks further into the crumb roof, and now the skids are getting tangled in the debris Roland races over to the hole, climbs in a few feet, and starts kicking at it, making it larger. ROLAND
Give me a ladder!

Malcolm tries to haul Kelly back up the way he came, but SECOND PTERANODON now appears from the depths of the buil SCREECHING in fury at these invaders who have landed in t middle of their clutch of eggs. An emergency rescue ladder drops through the hole in the Malcolm grabs Kelly with one arm and the ladder with the and they start to climb out of the nest.
Malcolm and Kelly climb the ladder and are pulled into th belly of the chopper just as two enormous beaks break through the surface of the roof around them. The pteranodons are emerging. MALCOLM

head_text.subj: GO GO GO GO GOG GO

text: The helicopter lurches up a few feet, but it yanked to an abrupt stop.  The engines WHINE, the chopper just hovers there. PILOT

We're snagged on something! They loos down. BOTH PTERANODONS have come out through th hole in the roof and are clinging to the skids of the helicopter.  They flap their gigantic wings in unison, an drag the helicopter off, into the air, away from the nest -- and let go.  Freed, the helicopter gains altitude quic
the PILOTS gape as the pteranodons coast along, right nex the helicopter. PILOT
Hang on!  If I tip it hard, I can cut 'em with the rotors! SARAH
NO!  Don't!  They're not attacking! They look out the windows, where, indeed, the magnificent animals are merely accompanying them, flying escort as th chopper gains altitude. SARAH (cont'd)

They're protecting their nest. That's all.  That's all they're doing. Kelly, completely drained, sits between Sarah and Malcolm each of whom has a protective arm around her.  She sags against her father's chest, nothing left. He holds her tight and WHISPERS in her ear. MALCOLM
Thank you.  Kelly, thank God.  Thank God for you...

over the island, the helicopter steadily gains altitude. hundred feet.  Three hundred.  A thousand. As the helicopter is clearly leaving the island, the pteranodons now peel off, their job done.  One of them ba sharply, right in front of the moon.  The moonlight silhouettes it, shining right through its membranous wing lighting it up like a Halloween skeleton. Below, the tiny green island melts away into the vastness the wine-dark sea.

Elsewhere in the forest, it's not such a happy story.  PE LUDLOW, still alive, drops through the air and CRUNCHES t muddy ground.  Dizzy, bleeding, the breath knocked out of he opens his eyes and sees a sloping bank of dried mud. From behind him, he hears a CHIRPING sound.  He turns. He's in the tyrannosaur nest. The BABY TYRANNOSAUR faces him, still with a strange aluminum-foil cast on its leg.  The baby SQUEAKS with excitement as it toddles toward him. Ludlow scrambles to his feet, unsure what to do.  Both AD TYRANNOSAURS stand outside the nest, staring down at him. The baby runs toward Ludlow, so he turns and runs away. But in an instant, the male brings its head down, knockin Ludlow to the ground.  Then it raises its head again. Watching.  Waiting. Ludlow gets up again and tries to run, but now the female strikes, knocking him over again. Ludlow tries to crawl away, on all fours.  The male bends and closes its jaws around one of his legs, holding it tightly.  Ludlow SCREAMS -- -- and the rex bits down decisively.  The bone breaks wit dry SNAP.  Ludlow HOWLS in pain, unable to move, and the toddles forward eagerly.  Ludlow can only stare as it lea up, onto his chest, and opens its jaws wide. Peter Ludlow SCREAMS.

Snow falls in a gray midwinter sky.  In a cemetery, a gro fifty MOURNERS is grouped around a gravesite next to a co that is festooned with cascades of flowers.  On a table, is an array of framed photographs -- -- of JOHN HAMMOND.  A MINISTER reads from the Bible whil Mourners wipe away tears.  IAN MALCOLM stands a respectfu distance from the group, KELLY right beside him.  Malcolm face is blank, tired, his sunburn out of place with the w winter setting around him. At gravesite, a Young Woman turns, looking back over her shoulder.  About sixteen, she's lovely, with long blonde and an honest, open face.  She notices Malcolm, recognize him. She nudges a Young Man next to her, about thirteen years The Young Man turns and breaks into a smile just as welco As the ceremony breaks up, they walk over to him. MALCOLM
Hello, Lex.  Tim. LEX stands on her tiptoes and kisses Malcolm on the cheek TIM extends a hand and Malcolm shakes it. MALCOLM (cont'd)
This is Kelly.  My daughter. They nod their hellos. LEX
I'm glad you came, Dr. Malcolm MALCOLM
I'm sorry about your grandfather. TIM
Thank you. LEX
We were going to call you, in a few days.  Tim and I have been thinking, and we've decided we want people to know about the island.  About what we all saw. TIM
We think it's something our grandfather would want us to do. MALCOLM (pause)
Why? LEX
Because it's true. Malcolm looks at her for a long moment. MALCOLM

I know, Lex.  But even if we're the only ones who ever know, it'll still be true.  You see, I've decided that if the world found out about what your grandfather created, it wouldn't be around for very long. LEX
But -- it was real.  You can't let people go on saying it's not. MALCOLM
That's the thing about reality. He looks down at Kelly. MALCOLM (cont'd)
Even when people stop believing in it, it doesn't go away. Kelly smiles and takes his hand, her slender fingers interlocking with his.
Back on Isla Sorna, we float over the deserted worker vil moving lightly, as in a dream. MALCOLM (V.O.)

Do you feel the cold wind blowing on your face?  That's real. We sweep low, landing on the roof the helicopter took off from, the nest below now careful rebuilt with straw and scrap, a dozen unblemished eggs in the middle of it. MALCOLM (V.O.)

Do you see the four of us, standing here together, alive?  That's real. A PTERANODON land gently on the nest.  Ever so carefully, positions itself over the eggs, lowers itself to roosting position, and folds its giant wings around its body. MALCOLM (V.O.)
And maybe that's still that matters. The animal raises its head, opens its beak, and SQUAWKS approvingly up at the heavens. FADE OUT
